text: Kader Khan (11 December 1937 - 31 December 2018) was an Afghan-born Indian- Canadian Actor, screenwriter, comedian, and director. As an actor, he appeared in over 300 films after his debut movie in the 1973 movie Daag: A Poem of Love in which he acted as a prosecuting attorney. Khan was a Muslim and completed a pilgrimage to Mecca called Hajj in 2014. Khan died from complications of progressive supranuclear palsy at a hospital in Mississauga, Ontario on 31 December 2018 at the age of 81. == References == Category:1937 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Afghan writers Category:Canadian comedians Category:Canadian movie actors Category:Canadian movie directors Category:Canadian Muslims Category:Canadian screenwriters Category:Canadian television actors Category:Canadian voice actors Category:Deaths from progressive supranuclear palsy Category:Disease-related deaths in Canada Category:Indian comedians Category:Indian actors Category:Indian writers Category:Indian movie directors Category:People from Kabul Category:20th- century Afghan people
title: Kader Khan
